intro: Miliusa paithalmalayana, commonly known as the Malabar satinash, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn from green to red as they mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
